description: Numbers n such that n remains prime through 3 iterations of function f(x) = 4x + 3.
comments: n, 4*n+3, 16*n+15 and 64*n+63 are primes. [From _Vincenzo Librandi_, Aug 04 2010]
maple: f:=proc(x) options operator, arrow: 4*x+3 end proc: a:=proc(n) if isprime(n)= true and isprime(f(n))=true and isprime(f(f(n)))=true and isprime(f(f(f(n)))) =true then n else end if end proc: seq(a(n),n=1..20000); - _Emeric Deutsch_, Jan 01 2008
prog: (MAGMA) [n: n in [1..150000] | IsPrime(n) and IsPrime(4*n+3) and IsPrime(16*n+15) and IsPrime(64*n+63)] [From _Vincenzo Librandi_, Aug 04 2010]
author: _David W. Wilson_
